H0.text: Heat is the difference between water and ice that causes ice to float on cold water.

H1.text: Shape is the difference between water and ice that results in ice floating on cold water.

H2.text: Density is the difference between water and ice that causes ice to float on cold water.

H3.text: Volume is the difference between water and ice that causes ice to float on cold water.

A4.text: If you make water very salt by mixing salt in with it, eggs will float on it.
